metadata.title: CVE-2017-9064 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 4.7.5, a Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF)vulnerability exists in the filesystem credentials dialog because a nonceis not required for updating credentials.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
